com.badlogic.gdx.graphics
Class OrthographicCamera

java.lang.Object
  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.OrthographicCamera

public class OrthographicCamera
extends java.lang.Object

An orthographic camera having a position and a scale value for zooming. Looks at one of the sides given in the OrthographicCamera.Side enums, default is front, looking along the z-Axis. Generally you will want to alter the camera's scale and position and then set its matrices via a call to OrthographicCamera.setMatrices() which takes an Application instance. You can get a picking ray via a call to OrthographicCamera.getPickRay().

Author:
mzechner

update

public void update()
Updates the frustum as well as the matrices of the camera based on the near and far plane, the position, the side and the scale.

setMatrices

public void setMatrices(Application app)
Sets the projection matrix that also incorporates the camera's scale and position and loads an identity to the model view matrix of the Application. The current matrices get overwritten. The matrix mode will be left in the model view state after a call to this.

Parameters:
app - The application to set the matrices for.

getPickRay

public Ray getPickRay(int screenX,
                      int screenY)
Returns a ray in world space form the given screen coordinates. This can be used for picking. The returned Ray is an internal member of this class to reduce memory allocations. Do not reuse it outside of this class.

Parameters:
screenX - The screen x-coordinate
mouse_y - The screen y-coordinate
Returns:
The picking ray.

Returns:
The combined matrix.
